skill.name: adaptyv
skill.description: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins and needing experimental validation including binding assays, expression testing, thermostability measurements, enzyme activity assays, or protein sequence optimization. Also use for submitting experiments via API, tracking experiment status, downloading results, optimizing protein sequences for better expression using computational tools (NetSolP, SoluProt, SolubleMPNN, ESM), or managing protein design workflows with wet-lab validation.
skill.summary: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 304 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is legitimate scientific software for protein research. Scanner patterns triggered on: FASTA format headers (protein sequences in markdown code blocks), API calls to official platform endpoints, environment variable usage for API keys (recommended practice), and scientific notation (e.g., binding affinity values like 1.2e-9). No malicious behavior confirmed.

content.user_title: Submit protein sequences for cloud lab validation
content.value_statement: Protein design requires experimental validation. Adaptyv provides API access to a cloud laboratory for automated testing of binding affinity, expression levels, thermostability, and enzyme activity. Get experimental results in approximately 21 days.
actual_capabilities: Submit protein sequences for binding, expression, thermostability, and enzyme activity assays
Track experiment status and receive webhook notifications upon completion
Download experimental results including KD, kon, koff, yield, and quality metrics
Integrate with computational tools like NetSolP, SolubleMPNN, and ESM for sequence optimization
Search target catalog and request custom antigens for binding experiments
limitations: Results typically take 21 days turnaround time from submission
API access requires registration and API key from adaptyvbio.com
Not all platform features are available via API during alpha/beta phase

use_cases.title: Antibody affinity testing
use_cases.description: Submit antibody variants to measure binding affinity against target antigens and identify high-affinity candidates.

use_cases.title: Sequence optimization validation
use_cases.description: Use computational tools to design protein variants, then experimentally validate expression and stability predictions.

use_cases.title: Catalytic activity screening
use_cases.description: Screen enzyme variants for improved turnover, substrate affinity, and inhibitor sensitivity.

prompt_templates.title: Submit binding assay
prompt_templates.prompt: Submit my antibody sequences to Adaptyv for binding assays against human PD-L1. The sequences are in FASTA format and I want to measure KD values.

prompt_templates.title: Check experiment status
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the status of experiment exp_abc123xyz and tell me the current stage and estimated completion date.

prompt_templates.title: Download results
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the results from experiment exp_abc123xyz and parse the binding measurements into a table showing sequence, KD, kon, and koff values.

prompt_templates.title: Run optimization pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize my protein sequences using NetSolP and SolubleMPNN, then submit the top 50 candidates to Adaptyv for expression testing with webhook notification.

output_examples.input: Submit two antibody sequences for binding assays against PD-L1
What is the status of my binding experiment?
Download and summarize the binding results

best_practices: Pre-screen sequences with computational tools (NetSolP, ESM) before experimental submission to reduce costs
Use webhooks instead of polling for experiment completion notifications
Include wild-type or reference sequences as controls in every batch submission
anti_patterns: Submitting sequences without validation - always run computational screening first
Polling for status instead of using webhooks - wastes API quota and adds delay
Ignoring FASTA format requirements - validate sequences locally before submission

faq.question: How long does it take to get results?
faq.answer: Most experiments deliver results in approximately 21 days from submission.

faq.question: How do I get API access?
faq.answer: Contact support@adaptyvbio.com to request access during the alpha/beta period.

faq.question: What experiment types are supported?
faq.answer: Binding assays (BLI), expression testing, thermostability (DSF), and enzyme activity assays.

faq.question: Can I test binding against custom targets?
faq.answer: Yes, use the POST /targets/request endpoint to request custom antigens not in the catalog.

faq.question: How many sequences can I submit?
faq.answer: Up to 1000 experiments per day per organization with batch submissions recommended.

faq.question: How are results delivered?
faq.answer: Results are available via API download with raw data URLs and quality metrics including confidence scores.
